column1: Some people claim that eating sugar (such as sucrose), aspartame (NutraSweet), and artificial flavors and colors lead to hyperactivity and other behavior problems in children.
In some cases, a special diet of foods without artificial flavors or colors works for a child, because the family and the child interact in a different way when the child eliminates these foods.
Refined (processed) sugars may have some effect on children's activity.
There are many reasons to limit the sugar a child has other than the effect on activity level.
- A diet high in sugar is a major cause of tooth decay.
High-sugar foods also have extra calories that can lead to obesity.
- Some people have allergies to dyes and flavors.
If a child has a diagnosed allergy, talk to a dietitian.
For lunch, fiber is found in whole-grain breads, peaches, grapes, and other fresh fruits.
